title: Ancient wonder
text:
Must visit site when in Athens.
Remember :
1.Should reach in morning before 9am... I reached after 10am and so it was very sunny and also a slow moving big queue as there was only one entrance.
2.Single ticket = 20 euros; Multiple site ticket=30 Euros. Try buying tickets in advance.
3.Wear good climbing shoes
4.Carry a bottle of water
5.Read it's history before visiting

title: A piece of history
text: Old city is close to the city centre. Walk around to explore the lanes among the old buildings , with a few souvenir shops scattered here and there. Shirivansha palace is a must visit site. Miniature library, mosques etc add to the experience..

title: Good hotel alongside the sea and the boulevard
text: Good hotel just beside hotel Hilton about 30 minutes drive from the airport. We chose a seaview room on the 7th floor and got a beautiful view of the sea and the boulevard. The room and bathroom size were smaller than expected. Most of attractions in Baku city is close by. Two malls and Nizami street are at walking distance. The staff were friendly but only a few speak English. Got stuck in the elevator once.
place: Park Inn by Radisson Azerbaijan Baku Hotel

title: Green patch in desert
text:
Plus points: the greenery, well maintained flora...large spacious rooms....30 acres of area... good walkways....good spa... decent restaurant....locatedjust 5 minutes drive from Barka
Cons: dirty pool...on notifying the management, said it was due to maintainable work... hope it is resolved soon. Not much activities for kids...bring your kids bicycle along.

title: Natural wonder
text: Travel around 190 km from Muscat, near Nizwa to visit this natural wonder. Prebook/ book on site your tickets for the one hour guided tour, which includes a 3 minute mini train ride to the cave from the main building. The cave takes you a prehistoric wonderland, with stalactites and rocks and lake with the rare blind fish... unfortunately no photography was allowed during our trip inside the cave. A small geological museum upstairs , a cafe and a souvenir shop is present in the entrance complex, enough to spent around 2 to 3 hours there.

title: TROPICAL PARADISE
text: Very pure beach .... pristine water... away from the polluted world... experience swimming with the colorful fish and baby sharks.... Very large property with over 1000 guests at a time....Very good buffet... rent a bicycle for your exploration in the island. People with young kids... carry your kids favorites chips n cookies as there is not much choice to shop once you arrive in the island.... the nearest civilization is miles away.

title: BETTER OF THE LOT
text: Stayed in Male city after a wonderful vacation in an island... So was disappointed with the island v/s city stay. The hotel is good, considering the space restraints in the city.Located in the centre of the city island, most landmarks are easily accessible in a 10 to 15 minute walk. Buffet was decent.

title: Tiny beach in the city
text: If you are looking for a proper beach experience... pack your bags and go to an island resort. This artificial island is mainly suited for the locals in the city who wants a quick dip.

title: Descent hotel in the city
text: The hotel is located around 1 hour drive from the airport. Situated in the city with shopping centres nearby- like Treminal 21 mall is 2 minutes walk from hotel, Indira square is around 5 km. Though aged, is well maintained. Complementary breakfast was good.

title: Good hotel
text: The hotel is around 45 minutes drive from the Phuket airport, Though the portico is not impressive, the inside of hotel was very good. The rooms were well maintained with a view towards the swimming pool. The swimming pool is large, but not deep with multiple layers and section. The buffet breakfast was excellent. Housekeeping was very good. There are multiple resaturants... Had lunch from from Casablanca- the Indoarabic restaurant - here the food was average.

title: Excellent resort
text: A very good resort with a view of the rapids , located not far from the city ideal for a one day break from the busy schedules. The hotel staff took us for a 2 km walk along the river and forest, There are areas where you can take a dip and also areas which is notorious for drowning, so caution is required if you plan to get down in the water. Lunch was good, but a bit overpriced. All rooms face an beautiful swimming pool. An ideal getaway with both friends and family.

title: Nature at its best
text: You can get to the James bond island in boats & ferrys. There are areas where you can ride your own canopies , shallow water for swimming, cave rides, lagoons & of course the Star- 007 island with its view. if your lucky the guide may attract eagles towards your boat and feed them. Avoid rainy season for thorough enjoyment.
placeLocation: Ao Phang Nga National Park, Thailand
